overview:
As President of CCH Small Firm Services (SFS), Jeff Gramlich has full profit and loss responsibilities for one of the fastest growing and most profitable businesses within the Wolters Kluwer organization. SFS serves more than 45,000 professional firms in all 50 states and Puerto Rico, providing tax and accounting software, research and training solutions.

Prior to being named to his current position in late 2006, Gramlich was the Executive VP of Business Development for CCH Tax and Accounting. He spearheaded a number of key acquisitions in the U.S., Canada and Australia, including the purchases of Universal Tax Systems and ATX/Kleinrock that led to the creation of SFS.

Before joining CCH in 2003, Gramlich was with The Thomson Corporation for five years and with CLR Fast-Tax for 10 years. His tax career began with Arthur Young.

Gramlich is a CPA, a member of the Dallas Chapter of the Texas Society of CPAs and the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants. He is also a Certified Information Technology Professional. Gramlich is a 1982 graduate of the University of Arkansas with a Bachelorâ€™s degree in Accounting.
